b2bpl.bpl.analysis
Class BasicBlock

java.lang.Object
  b2bpl.graph.AbstractVertex<BasicBlock,Edge>
      b2bpl.bpl.analysis.BasicBlock

public class BasicBlock
extends AbstractVertex<BasicBlock,Edge>

Concrete subclass of an AbstractVertex to be used in conjunction with the Edge class in the ControlFlowGraph of a BoogiePL procedure implementation.

Since a BoogiePL procedure implementation already consists of a set of basic blocks as required for a control flow graph, this class is basically a simple wrapper class around a BPLBasicBlock.

Author:
Ovidio Mallo
See Also:
Edge, ControlFlowGraph, BPLBasicBlock

private BPLBasicBlock bplBlock
The BoogiePL basic block belonging to this basic block or null if no such block exists.

Constructor Detail

BasicBlock

public BasicBlock()
Constructs a new basic block in the control flow graph containing no BoogiePL basic block. This constructor should only be used for the synthetic entry and exit blocks created in every control flow graph.

BasicBlock

public BasicBlock(BPLBasicBlock bplBlock)
Constructs a new basic block in the control flow graph around the given BoogiePL basic block bplBlock.

Parameters:
bplBlock - The BoogiePL basic block belonging to the basic block being created or null if no such block exists.
Method Detail

newPredecessorEdge

protected Edge newPredecessorEdge(BasicBlock predecessor)
Description copied from class: AbstractVertex
Special method used to delegate the creation of a new predecessor edge for this vertex to a concrete subclass. Such a method is necessary since Java provides no runtime support for generics, meaning that we cannot directly instantiate an object whose type is a type parameter.

Specified by:
newPredecessorEdge in class AbstractVertex<BasicBlock,Edge>
Parameters:
predecessor - The predecessor of this vertex.
Returns:
The newly created predecessor edge.
